results.title: Bran nue dae
results.creator_credit: Jimmy Chi, Tom Zubrycki and Bran Nue Dae Productions
results.brief_description: An inspirational film on the production of the Aboriginal musical ‘Bran Nue Dae’ and the life of Jimmy Chi, its creator. Chi has suffered from schizophrenia since he was a university student but remains undaunted by his illness. ‘Bran Nue Dae’ is largely the work of Chi with the pooled talents of Broome band, Knuckles. The musical is a story of an Aboriginal boy’s flight from the city of Perth to his homeland at Djaridjin. His journey in search of identity, love and security takes us across the state in a blend of rock-opera, road-movie, comedy, song, dance, and romance.

results.title: Brain story. Eps. 01-03
results.creator_credit: Andrew Cohen, Sam Starbuck and BBC
results.brief_description: ‘Brain Story’ is a series of six programs exploring the latest research on brain function. Professor Susan Greenfield CBE, presenter of the series, uses current scientific technology to help answer a number of philosophical questions about who we are as people and what makes you ‘you’ and the brain’s role in this. Episode 1: “All in the mind” introduces the series and addresses broadly the range of functions that the brain is responsible for from spirituality to the very nature of conscious experience. Episode 2: “In the heat of the moment” explores what makes life worth living and asks whilst looking at the range of human emotions ‘How does the brain create intense feelings of love, fear, anger and joy?’. Episode 3: “The Mind’s Eye” explores how the brain generates vision. Movement, shape, colour and size are all constructed in our mind. The brain processes very little of what we see because our eyes are slaves to our attention system. “The Mind’s eye” concerns itself with illusion and reality and how our brain interprets and influences our perception.

results.title: Bravery in the field
results.creator_credit: Giles Walker, Roman Kroitor, Stefan Wodoslawsky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Tommy is a veteran of World War II. He rooms alone, waiting for his pension cheque to arrive, passing the time in the evenings with his cronies in the Legion Hall. Lennie can claim only a third of Tommy’s years, but he prowls the same area of town, and, surprisingly enough, they have more in common than either of them realises. Bravery in the Field portrays the frustration’s and hostilities of these two men whose lives lack a sense of place and purpose. This dramatised story occurs early in November and leads up to an event that provides one of Tommy’s few remaining moments of glory: the annual veterans’ Remembrance Day parade. Stars Les Rubie and Matt Craven. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: Braveheart [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mel Gibson, Alan Ladd Jnr, Bruce Davey, ICON, Ladd Company and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Medieval epic set in 13th Century Scotland. “Braveheart” follows the fortunes of the legendary Sir William Wallace, the Scottish Higlander who led his people in rebellion against Edward Ist. of England. Gibson’s film made its mark on the 1995 Academy Awards, being an epic in the old style, filled with gigantic battle scenes and larger than life characters. Starring Mel Gibson as William Wallace, Sophie Marceau and Patrick McGoohan. A tale about oppression and the courage to oppose it.

results.title: Brave Irene
results.creator_credit: Daniel Ivanick, Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Irene’s mother is a seamstress who has been chosen to make a dress for the Duchess to wear to the big ball. When her mother gets sick, Irene decides to take the dress to the duchess herself. On the way there it begins to snow, but Irene is determined to reach the palace before the ball. Narrated by Lindsay Crouse. Based on the book by William Steig.

results.title: Branchline railway
results.brief_description: Michael Palin, confessed train buff, introduces unique footage from the BBC archive: Branchline Railway and two historic newsreel sequences - a splendid requiem for the steam railway. “Branchline Railway”: the late Sir John Betjeman presents this little known film which perfectly captures the atmosphere of a 24 mile stretch of the now vanished Somerset and Dorset railway. It celebrates a working, living railway, complete with dirty locomotives, clean stations decked with flowers, and austere gas-lit waiting rooms. It all belongs to a vanished age but the film remains to delight and inform (broadcast 1963). “Britannia under her own steam” looks at the naming of the first magnificent Class 7 4-6-2 Standard locomotives ‘Britannia’ (broadcast 1951). “Atlantic Coast Express” is a footplate journey on Merchant Navy Class No. 35016 ‘Elder Fyffe’ as it heads the ‘Atlantic Coast Express’ (broadcast 1960).

results.title: Brain story. Eps. 04-06
results.creator_credit: Sam Roberts, Thecla Schreuders, Zoe Heron and BBC
results.brief_description: Brain Story is a series of six programs exploring the latest research on brain function. Professor Susan Greenfield CBE, presenter of the series, uses current scientific technology to help answer a number of philosophical questions about who we are as people and what makes you ‘you’ and the brain’s role in this. Episode 4: “First amongst equals” investigates why humans use their brains beyond survival instincts. The frontal lobes in our brain controls our ability to plan and make goals. An extensive study of chimpanzees and their language ability is used to illustrate the difference between animal and human brain function and why we as humans seek to excel beyond survival. Episode 5: “Growing the mind” explores how memory is developed throughout our lives, the physical conditions to facilitate this in the brain and how beyond ‘semantic memory’ our memory defines us as individuals. Episode 6: “The Final mystery” explores vividly how the brain creates the conscious experience of being you. Greenfield establishes how our daily actions are the result of slowly emerging sub-conscious processes in the brain. (Episode 6 features The Jim Rose Circus).

results.title: Bound [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lana Wachowski, Lilly Wachowski, Andrew Lazar, Stuart Boros and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: A stylish and sexy noir thriller directed by the Wachowski Brothers. Corky (Gina Gershon) has just finished a stint in the slammer, and has been hired to renovate the apartment next door to Caeser (Joe Pantoliano), and his vampish girlfriend, Violet (Jennifer Tilly). Violet pursues Corky and they have an affair, which leads to them plotting to steal two million dollars of stashed Mafia money currently in Caeser’s custody. Can they pull off this daring theft, or will an unexpected twist in their otherwise flawless plan lead to their downfall?
